posts.content: Having learned a lot since 2011, I have updated the build and also added a re-imagining of the build as a Monk 22 / DD 18, but I kept the entire original post in a spoiler.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Why not 12 monk / 8 DD pre-epic?

Also, I suspect 2 levels of Assassin (or Rogue) would not go awry in that build.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
With an unarmed Monk, you want to get to Monk 16 as soon as possible, for the d20 fists.

Why do you think Rogue or Assassin would be good in this build?  You already have a Tumble class (Monk), and the Defensive Awareness feat from DD protects your DEX AC just like Uncanny Dodge.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
UMD at low cost to the build (1-2 SR hit). Less Monk pre-epic for the AB. Both monk and DD offer no Self buff AB opportunities and monk is 3/4 BAB class with Flurry making it worse.

You can wear the unarmed damage delay and probably should anyway on most PWs. Until epics and (hopefully) decent gloves, wield a weapon the +1 AB makes up for the temp delay of the Weapon Focus bonus until you get both bonuses and solid unarmed damage.


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
As I understand it, in a PW, leveling is just a preliminary, and the real game doesn't start until level 40.  If that is the case, you should take 8 Monk, 4 Fighter, and 8 DD pre-epic to maximize your level 40 AB.  I have never played on a PW, so I build for single-player, where the game is almost over when and if you reach level 40.

It has been my experience that even when I am focusing on dual kamas, it is better to fight unarmed until level 10 or 12 or so, when I can get decent kamas.  Using any other weapon would cost me some attacks per round, and maybe some other Monk bonuses, too.

In the Fighter-free version, Rogue 2 for skills is indeed tempting.
